WHAT MAKES THIS YOUR FAVORITE DETAIL?

About you

To participate in the competition we need a few informations about you. You can either connect with Facebook or fill out the blanks with your name and e-mail adress.

Thank you

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.

Competition guidelines

Terms of use – e-mail

To participate in the "Blue Elements competition" you must sign up with your e-mail address and give permission to receive e-mails from Royal Copenhagen.

When you sign up, you allow Royal Copenhagen to contact you by e-mail with news, competitions and special offers within Royal Copenhagen's range. Your e-mail address could also be used for targeted marketing, for example on Facebook. Your e-mail address will not be shared with third parties. You can always delete your profile or withdraw your consent to receive marketing material. Read more about Royal Copenhagen's privacy policy here.

Competition guidelines

When you have uploaded your favorite detail and/or your text it will shown on the Blue Elements campaign site where we collect all participants contributions. If your contribution is shown on the site it does not mean that you have won one of the prizes. Royal Copenhagen selects six contributions, which we believe is the best, most beautiful or most creative suggestions for a favorite detail.

Royal Copenhagen announce the winners the 5th of May 2015.If you are one of the winners, you will be notified directly by e-mail.

The prize is one "Sky Shaped Dish" to a value of 649 Danish kr. The prizes have a total value of 3.894 Danish kr.

If due to technical errors, there will be more winners than prizes, we reserve the right to draw six winners among the winning numbers. The competition runs through the 3rd of May 2015.

The contest is not sponsored, organized or administered by Facebook. You give your information to Royal Copenhagen and not to Facebook. When you enter the competition you accept Facebook's general terms of use.

Nyhed

Sky Shaped Dish
649,00 DKK vejl.udsalgspris

Blue elements is a new narrative built from fragments of old stories

Stories of kings and queens; Chinese flower patterns; the infinity of blue; and a brave designer who dismantled a 240-year-old design tradition to bring it together and bring it to life in a new form.

Louise Campbell’s Blue Elements is a spectacular mixture of Flora Danica, Blue Fluted Plain and the classic flutes. A playful use of classical elements, where flowers grow wild, flutes suddenly turn smooth and the edge is interrupted by lace rim.

Fad
649,00 DKK vejl.udsalgspris

Designeren af Blue Elements

Louise Campbell is a pioneer in innovative, contemporary design and one of the world’s leading creative talents. She has won numerous awards for her design work and has a knack for twisting familiar elements to create something new and unique.

The 3 elements in blue elements

Blue Elements was launched in 2011 and is inspired by the jagged edging from Flora Danica, classic fluting, exquisite lace and luxurious flower motifs.

Dyb tallkerken
599,00 DKK vejl.udsalgspris

  • The main flower in the classic pattern is called chrysanthemum
  • The Royal Copenhagen blue is called Cobalt Zinc Silicate
  • A blue-painter spends four years learning his or her craft
